gurmukhi: qiRpurY iek dYq biFXo qiRpurM ]ijh qyj qpY riv ijau qiRpurM ]
transliteration: Tripurai Ik Dait Badhiyo Tripuran|| Jih Tej Tapai Rav(i) Jio Tripuran||
translation: In Trupura State lived a three-eyed demons, whose glory was equal to the glory of the Sun, which spread over the three worlds.

gurmukhi: brdwie mhwsur AYs BXo ]ijn lok cqur ds jIq lXo ]9]
transliteration: Bardaae Mahaasur Ais Bhayo|| Jin Lok Chatur Das Jeet Layo||9||
translation: After receiving the boon, that demons become so powerful that he conquered all the fourteen regions of the universe.9.

gurmukhi: joaU eyk hI bwx hxY qiRpurM ]soaU nws krY iqh dYq durM ]
transliteration: Jooo Ek Hibaan Hanai Tripuooan|| Sooo Naas Darai Tih Dait Duran||
translation: (That demon had this boon) that anyone who had the power to kill him with one arrow, he only could kill that terrible demon.

gurmukhi: As ko pRgtXo kb qwih gnY ]iek bwx hI so pur qIn hnY ]10]
transliteration: As Ko Pragtyo Kab Taah(i) Gadai|| Ik Baan Hiso Pur Teen Hanai||10||
translation: The poet now wants to describe that mighty warrior who could kill that three-eyed demon with one arrow.10.

gurmukhi: isv Dwie clXo iqh mwrn ko ]jg ky sB jIv auDwrn ko ]
transliteration: Siv Dhaae Chadyo Tih Maaran Ko|| Jag Ke Sabh Jeev Udhaaran Ko||
translation: For the protection of the beings of the world and the killing of that demon, the god Shiva moved forward.

gurmukhi: kr kop qjXo isq su`D srM ]iek bwr hI nws kIXo qiRpurM ]11]
transliteration: Kar Kop Tajyo Sit Suddh Saran|| Ik Baar Hinaas Kiyo Tripuran||11||
translation: In great fury, shot one arrow and only with arrow, he destroyed that demon of Tripura, named Tripura.11.

gurmukhi: lK kauqk swD sBY hrKy ]sumnM brKw nB qy brKy ]
transliteration: Lakh Kaoutak Saadh Sabhai Harkhe|| Soumanan Barkhaa Nabh Te Barkhe||
translation: Seeing this performance all the saints were pleased and gods showered flowers form heaven.

gurmukhi: Duin pUir rhI jX s`d hUAM ]igr hym hlwcl kMp BUAM ]12]
transliteration: Dhoun(i) Poor(i) Rahijay Sadd Hooan|| Gir Hem Halaachal Kanp Bhooan||12||
translation: The sound of “hail, hail” resound, there was consternation on Himalaya mountain and the earth tembled.12.

gurmukhi: idn kyqk bIq gey jb hI ]AsurMDk bIr bIXo qb hI ]
transliteration: Din Ketak Beet Gad Jab Hee|| Asurandhak Beer Beeyo Tah Hee||
translation: After a long time, another demons named Andhakasura came on the scene;

gurmukhi: qb bYl cVXo gih sUl isvM ]sur cauk cly hir kop ikvM ]13]
transliteration: Tab Bail Chadyo Gad(i) Sool Sivan|| Sur Shaouk Chale Har(i) Kop Kivan||13||
translation: Mounting his bull and holding his trident, Shiva moved forward (to chastise him). Seeing his terrible form, the gods were also startled.13.
